header.topics: Christmas, Family life, work and conferences

he used to go to playgroup in

wants to buy me a Christmas present with it
take her to the ninety-nine P shop
I said no and then she said oh can I buy ice creams?
yeah that's more that's more like it isn't it oh bless her oh dear so how was work last week?
yeah it was alright I was sat next to her I didn't recognise who she was the best thing about the the conference was really good this year by the way
one of the best things about it massive name tags so you didn't have to like squint and peer at people's like chest to work out who they were
did she know who you were then when you said?
when I said I'm she said oh do you know what she said? she said do you know what I've heard so much about you I thought I would recognise you instantly

but yeah we're in a really interesting talk actually a CLIL which was really good erm by the same guy that did the erm FCE talk but he was a lot better and he was talking about his own thing erm and yeah yeah we just had a chat and she said why haven't you worked at ? it was a bit weird for me at the conference cos Kaplan were there support for English were there were there were all there and I was like oh like and also some people Kaplan from Kaplan in Salisbury were there as well so I got to scope out the guy who I'm probably going to have to have some contact with this summer which was quite good because they're always notoriously difficult

and the principal who I've met on various occasions had lots of conversations with either didn't recognise me or didn't want to talk to me which was fine because he's not so weird but yeah it was a bit odd especially like so who do you work for then? I was like last year I worked for and they're probably going to expect me to work there next year and secretly I'm going to go and work for but really I'd like to go and work for so you know it's all just a bit it was it was really good but it was a bit weird

erm yes so I talked to and she said why haven't you worked at ? and I just said well I don't know which I don't know why I haven't then I'd worked everywhere else so yeah yeah that was it really but yeah it was nice and she was talking about she is going back into the classroom
that's what she said and she described it as a demotion
she yeah she's all over the place

I also saw the other Sunday at this Christmas fair and she was like yes I'm going to managing ? and I sat there thinking that place next year until everyone finds their feet sounds like an absolute nightmare yeah
well 's new role is a bit of everyone's role
yeah that's yeah that's what she said
yeah and a lot of people weren't happy about it but
so a bit of everyone's? who's then?
a bit of everyone a bit of mine a bit of a bit of a bit of
they just created this role for her and

we get on yeah well we get on really well

she feels victimised at the moment
everything to do with work? or not everything to do with work? but she had to go off and do that job didn't she?
yeah she feels that they're trying to make her quit her job
that they're pushing her out they're trying to so
I don't know they're not making her feel very comfortable or welcome
but there's so few people that could do 's job well
but no one understands her job

yeah you have to be yeah I would say I haven't met them all 's the only one who can do it because you have to trav partly because you have to travel so much they'd be silly to try and push her out because other people aren't going to be able to do it you wouldn't be able to travel so much wouldn't be able to travel probably could do it but probably wouldn't want to
mm mm I know is doing three out of the seven summer schools and is doing the others
well that's quite enough for though on the on the other hand like how is she gonna do seven summer schools? that's far too many just for her
I bet she doesn't like that?
no I don't think that's a problem erm I don't really know what the problem is

mm well but yes no it was nice to meet her but yeah the conference was really good out of all the years to miss you really shouldn't have missed this one it was really good it was actually genuinely good not just good for a southwest conference
and most and lots of people who I spoke to said the talks were their talks were really good

it's really interesting so they had the new chair or chief exec whoever he is of English UK who was kind of blah blah blah blah blah blah you know like they are erm until this really pompous guy asked the most stupidest question which was really long-winded and clearly designed to test this guy's knowledge and trip him up so he said well you said this but obviously according to so and so's research from 1985 blah blah blah oh it was awful and the guy the guy that was doing the plenary very politely very thoroughly completely slammed him it was brilliant it was really good
erm so he was really interesting and then

was there in the afternoon he was wasn't saying particularly groundbreaking but as always had a slightly different slant on things it was he was talking about automaticity erm that he'd read some book and therefore was talking about it in the terms of the book that he'd read but yeah and how we learn and stuff but yeah he was interesting it was at the end of the day though so it's a bit much
yeah erm and I went to a talk on about teaching advanced learners which was really interesting
with a guy who's a doctor I think he's written quite a lot of course books
his wife died last year and that's why he didn't go
that's why the one the other one got cancelled last year erm how to make the best out of your team

oh I didn't realise he was supposed to go last year oh god well he did both of those this year how to make the best of your team I talked to about that it sounded interesting however he was coming at it from the point of view of working in a university
where you have minimum the minimum length of course is what four weeks? erm so it's quite different for having a permanent team of teachers as opposed to having a very fluid team of teachers

it's interesting though they'd erm I think I might do try and implement a couple of members at the summer school actually one of things they do is to have certain things that you have each lesson so erm every teacher puts a list of ten vocabulary words on the board and they all put them in the same place so either on the right-hand side or the left-hand side each lesson has three aims erm at the beginning of the lesson you write at the top of the board and they'd also introduce things like colour uniformity so you use colour for the same things so
that's what we tried to do for the inspection week
oh just for the inspection week?
the inspectors were there well it's something that came up leading to because we did so many workshops leading to this
and one of the things was to standardise the way we do we mark stress for example
because if you have a teacher then you go and get another teacher and the other teacher does it a different way it's just

well yeah I thought erm it sounded it sounded interesting erm and one of the benefits I think was when the students come and say well I don't like my teacher I don't feel like I'm learning enough if there's a clash of personalities he can go well actually I know that all the teachers do this in their class so the kind of the director of studies has a clear idea of what's actually going on and can talk to the students go well I know what's happening in your class because it happens in every class was nice I think I might try and they they'd done it as a negotiated thing with the permanent with the sort of permanent teachers so so they've negotiated all of these different things and without standardisation but with a summer school that's not really going to be possible I didn't want to have have to impose it because there's not time to negotiate with the teachers and if you've got an un unex inexperienced teacher then they don't really know yeah I think I might talk to the dossers and implement it have it as a top down thing you must do it like this I think although I think one of the London schools is going to have the Director of Studies and possibly some teachers from the London Kaplan school so I'm sure they won't do it

but yeah no I didn't go to that one I went to what did I go to when that one on? and then I went to one on storytelling

which was really interactive like almost I almost didn't go because he I walked in and it was all set up in a horseshoe and I was like oh no we're going to actually have to do something it was really nice though he's part of the charity called The Philosophy Foundation so partly storytelling it wasn't anything majorly interesting but it was mostly discussing philosophical ideas

tricking people tricking the students into discussing philosophical ideas it was very interesting actually it was all really good I was really surprised I didn't go last year and then this year it was great
